title: Does medical debt collection report to credit agency?
question: A medical debt was sent to collections (rather prematurely, but that's another story) and I was contacted via phone from the debt agency. They offered me an amount about 30% below the outstanding balance due to settle. I can comfortably pay the debt in one payment.
answers:
Check your credit reports immediately and see if it is on there. Assuming it isn't, then make the deal and have it confirmed in writing, and ask them to include a sentence that they have not reported it, and will not report it.

It seem possible that they don't have your social, as they insurance company may have interpreted HIPPA laws as preventing them from disclosing it.
